ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_carve: Cuts identical item entities, crafting them into stairs. Works on stone and wood only. §a[Create Recipe: Cutting]
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_pack: Condenses identical item entities, crafting them into 2x2 recipes. §a[Create Recipe: Pack]
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_polish: Refines item entities into their polished variants. §a[Create Recipe: Polish]
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_obliterate: Obliterates foes by sheer force with an arcane hammer. Can be augmented with Sensitive to process item entities. §a[Create Recipe: Crushing Wheels]
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_press: Flattens item entities into their pressed variants.
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_superheat: When used in combination with Fuse, super-heats ingredients
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_fuse: Fuses item entities by slamming them together at breakneck speed. Picks up fluids from nearby fluid containers. Can be combined with Smelt or Superheat (if enabled).
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_whirl: Creates a whirlwind in an area, causing item entities to be centrifuged. Combine with water/flare/smelt/hex to process items.
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_insert: Inserts item entities into nearby containers in a medium radius where this spell is activated
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_telefeast: Consumes the first edible/potion, or some amount of liquid, found in the container/tank this was cast on.
ars_technica.glyph_desc.glyph_apply: Uses the item in your offhand to perform Manual Item Application or Deploy to blocks or items. Non-player casters use adjacent inventories instead of off-hand
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_obliterat: Increases the size and damage of the hammer
Processes item entities instead of destroying them
Increases the chance of getting additional items from crushing recipes with diminishing returns
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_carve_gly: Increases the area in which item entities get collected for processing
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_pack_glyp: Increases the area in which item entities get collected for processing
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_polish_gl: Increases the amount of item entities processed
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_press_gly: Increases the amount of item entities processed
Uses Compact recipes (with nearby fluids) instead of Press when items can form one. Add Smelt for heated recipes.
Uses Packing (2x2/3x3 same-item crafting) instead of Press or Compact
With Extract: allows super-heated Compact recipes
ars_technica.effect_augment_desc.glyph_p: With Extract: use for heated Compact recipes
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_whirl_gly: Increases the size and the range of item entities being processed
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_fuse_glyp: Increases the amount of items processed
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_insert_gl: Evenly distributes items across all valid containers for balanced deposit
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_telefeast: Will try to 'use' an item even if it's not a drink/food (e.g. experience gems)
Forwards the consumable in a magic bubble
ars_nouveau.augment_desc.glyph_apply_gly: Increases the amount of items that can be applied to and the area of blocks affected
Increases the depth of blocks affected when targeting blocks
ars_technica.armor_set.technomancer.desc: Reduces damage from Create machinery, increases speed of nearby schematic cannons
ars_technica.armor_set.artificer.desc: Reduces damage from Create machinery, increases speed of nearby schematic cannons
ars_technica.armor_set.machinaguard.desc: Reduces damage from Create machinery, increases speed of nearby schematic cannons
ars_technica.create_goggles_info: Augments your HUD with miscellaneous information about placed Create components
ars_technica.ponder.source_motor.text_1: This block can be used to convert Source into rotational force.
ars_technica.ponder.source_motor.text_2: It must be supplied with a nearby Source Jar.
ars_technica.ponder.source_motor.text_3: Adjust the RPM on the sides of the motor, right-click elsewhere to adjust the SU-to-RPM ratio
ars_technica.ponder.source_motor.text_4: Adjusting the SU-to-RPM ratio will conversely adjust the amount of source required
create.gui.source_motor.title: Source Motor
ars_technica.tooltip.transmutation_turre: Casts spells infused with the Focus of Transmutation. Costs x%s more source.
ars_technica.tooltip.transmutation_focus: Augments spells with Luck and improves various glyphs
2x speed for Press, Polish and Whirl
2x items processed by Press and Polish
2x chance-based item outputs from Crush, Obliterate and Whirl
+1 Luck Augment per Glyph in your spell
ars_technica.perk_desc.thread_pressure: Grants the wielder ultra-high-pressure air. Air refills over time - higher levels means more capacity and faster fill rate.
ars_technica.category.ars_technica.desc: The intersection of Create machinery and Ars Nouveau spellcraft.
ars_technica.patchouli.technomancer.perk:
All three Technomancer variants (Technomancer, Artificer, Machinaguard) share these perks when wearing a full set:

$(li)$(bold)Damage reduction$() - Reduced damage from Create machinery (e.g. crushers, saws)
$(li)$(bold)Schematicannon boost$() - Nearby Schematic Cannons operate faster
$(li)$(bold)Manipulation school$() - Bonus manipulation spell power
$(li)$(bold)Goggles$() - The helmet augments your HUD with Create component info
ars_technica.page.create_processing.intr: The following glyphs can be used as substitutes for Create processes:
ars_technica.page.create_processing.depo: These process item entities placed in the world. Press, Polish, Obliterate and Whirl additionally function on Create depots.
ars_technica.page1.create_processing:
The following glyphs can be used as substitutes for Create processes:

These process item entities placed in the world. Press, Polish, Obliterate and Whirl additionally function on Create depots.
ars_technica.page1.processing: Ars Technica adds glyphs that perform Create-style processing: Pressing, Polishing, Mixing, Crushing, and more. Hover the glyphs below for Create recipe details.
ars_technica.page2.processing:
Depot support: Only Press, Polish, Obliterate, and Whirl work when cast on a Create Depot. Cast on the depot to automate processing from its inventory.

Carve, Pack, and Fuse work on item entities in the world only—they do not support depot automation.
ars_technica.page1.transmutation: Transmutation augments spells with Luck and improved processing. Focus: wear in Curios focus slot—hover for bonuses. Turret: automated caster with Focus applied, costs more source per cast.
ars_technica.page1.arcane_wrench: The Arcane Wrench is Create's Wrench augmented with Ars Nouveau magic. Obtain it by enchanting a Create Wrench in the Enchanting Apparatus.
ars_technica.page2.arcane_wrench:
Additional capabilities:

- Rune blocks: Right-click to configure cooldown
- Relays: Right-click to convert a Relay into a Precise Relay to configure its cooldown
- Pedestals, Turrets, Containment Jars: Sneak + right-click to pick up.
ars_technica.page.armor_set.technomancer: Attuned to Create machinery and the School of Manipulation, each piece of this armor will amplify manipulation glyphs, reduce damage from Create machinery like crushers and saws, and the helmet augments your HUD with Create component info. When all the pieces are equipped, nearby Schematic Cannons operate faster
